simplesect.para: True if the V5 Brain is disabled, false otherwise.
True if the V5 Brain is disabled, false otherwise.
True if the V5 Brain is disabled, false otherwise.
True if the V5 Brain is disabled, false otherwise.

True if the V5 Brain is in autonomous mode, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: The master controller.
The partner controller.
The horizontal axis of the controller’s left analog stick.
The vertical axis of the controller’s left analog stick.
The horizontal axis of the controller’s right analog stick.
The vertical axis of the controller’s right analog stick.
The first trigger on the left side of the controller.
The second trigger on the left side of the controller.
The first trigger on the right side of the controller.
The second trigger on the right side of the controller.
The up arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The down arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The left arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The right arrow on the left arrow pad of the controller.
The ‘X’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘B’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘Y’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
The ‘A’ button on the right button pad of the controller.
Checks if the controller is connected.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER

simplesect.para: 1 if the controller is connected, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Gets the value of an analog channel (joystick) on a controller.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The analog channel to get. Must be one of ANALOG_LEFT_X, ANALOG_LEFT_Y, ANALOG_RIGHT_X, ANALOG_RIGHT_Y

simplesect.para: The current reading of the analog channel: [-127, 127]. If the controller was not connected, then 0 is returned

briefdescription.para: Gets the battery capacity of the given controller.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER

simplesect.para: The controller's battery capacity

briefdescription.para: Gets the battery level of the given controller.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER

simplesect.para: The controller's battery level

briefdescription.para: Checks if a digital channel (button) on the controller is currently pressed.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The button to read. Must be one of DIGITAL_{RIGHT,DOWN,LEFT,UP,A,B,Y,X,R1,R2,L1,L2}

simplesect.para: 1 if the button on the controller is pressed. If the controller was not connected, then 0 is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns a rising-edge case for a controller button press.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not thread-safe. Multiple tasks polling a single button may return different results under the same circumstances, so only one task should call this function for any given button. E.g., Task A calls this function for buttons 1 and 2. Task B may call this function for button 3, but should not for buttons 1 or 2. A typical use-case for this function is to call inside opcontrol to detect new button presses, and not in any other tasks.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The button to read. Must be one of DIGITAL_{RIGHT,DOWN,LEFT,UP,A,B,Y,X,R1,R2,L1,L2}

simplesect.para: 1 if the button on the controller is pressed and had not been pressed the last time this function was called, 0 otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (controller_id_e_t id, uint8_t line, uint8_t col, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: controller_print

briefdescription.para: Sets text to the controller LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller text setting is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port. EAGAIN - Could not send the text to the controller.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The line number at which the text will be displayed [0-2]
The column number at which the text will be displayed [0-14]
The format string to print to the controller
The argument list for the format string

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (controller_id_e_t id, uint8_t line, uint8_t col, const char *str)
memberdef.name: controller_set_text

briefdescription.para: Sets text to the controller LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller text setting is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port. EAGAIN - Could not send the text to the controller.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The line number at which the text will be displayed [0-2]
The column number at which the text will be displayed [0-14]
The pre-formatted string to print to the controller

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Clears an individual line of the controller screen.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller text setting is currently in beta, so continuous, fast updates will not work well.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The line number to clear [0-2]

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Clears all of the lines on the controller screen.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller text setting is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port. EAGAIN - Could not send the text to the controller.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Rumble the controller.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller rumble activation is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
A string consisting of the characters '.', '-', and ' ', where dots are short rumbles, dashes are long rumbles, and spaces are pauses. Maximum supported length is 8 characters.

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current voltage of the battery, as reported by VEXos.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the battery port.

simplesect.para: The current voltage of the battery

briefdescription.para: Gets the current current of the battery, as reported by VEXos.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the battery port.

simplesect.para: The current current of the battery

briefdescription.para: Gets the current temperature of the battery, as reported by VEXos.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the battery port.

simplesect.para: The current temperature of the battery

briefdescription.para: Gets the current capacity of the battery, as reported by VEXos.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the battery port.

simplesect.para: The current capacity of the battery

briefdescription.para: Checks if the SD card is installed.

simplesect.para: 1 if the SD card is installed, 0 otherwise

memberdef.name: CONTROLLER_PORT_MUTEX_TAKE
memberdef.initializer: switch (id) { \ case E_CONTROLLER_MASTER: \ port = V5_PORT_CONTROLLER_1; \ break; \ case E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER: \ port = V5_PORT_CONTROLLER_2; \ break; \ default: \ errno = EINVAL; \ return PROS_ERR; \ } \ if (!internal_port_mutex_take(port)) { \ errno = EACCES; \ return PROS_ERR; \ } \

simplesect.para: Additional example code for this module can be found in its Tutorial.
